gurmukhi: sMg lXo Anru`D ko dUqI hrK bFwie ] aUKw ko pur Qo jhw qhwN phUcI Awie ]2203]
transliteration: San Layo Anruddh Ko Dootiharakh Badhaae|| Ookhaa Ko Pur Tho Jahaa Tahaan Pahoochiaae||2203||
translation: Getting pleased, the messenger took Aniruddh with her and reached the city of Usha.2203.

gurmukhi: qiRA ipX dXo imlwie cqur qRIAw kr cqurqw ] kIXo Bog suK pwie aUKw Aru Anru`D iml ]2204]
transliteration: Tri Piva Dayo Milaae Chatur Treeyaa Kar Chaturtaa|| Keeyo Bhog Soukh Paae Ookhaa Ar(u) Anruddh Mil||2204||
translation: That woman caused cleverly the meeting of both-the lover and the beloved; Usha and Aniruddh then enjoyed the union with great delight.2204.

gurmukhi: cwr pRkwr ko Bog kIXo nr nwr hulws hIXY mY bFY kY ] Awsn kok ky bIc ijqy kib BwKq hY su sBY ien kY kY ]
transliteration: Chaar Prakaar Ko Bhog Keeyo Nar Naar Hulaas Heeyai Mai Badhai Kai|| Oosan Kok Ke Beech Jite Kab(i) Bhaakhat Hai Su Sabhai In Kai Kai||
translation: Getting pleased in their mind following the instruction of Koka Pundit about the postures of the union, they enjoyed the sexual union through four kinds of postures;

gurmukhi: bwq khI Anru`D kCU muskwie qRIAw sMg nYn ncY kY ] ijau hmrI qum huie rhI suMdir iqau hm hU qumry rhy hÍY kY ]2205]
transliteration: Baat Kahianruddh Bachhodh Mouskaae Treeaa San Nain Nachai Kai|| Jio Hamritoum Hue Rahisoundar(i) Tio Ham Hoo Toumre Rahe Hvai Kai||2205||
translation: Aniruddh said smilingly to Usha, causing his eyes to dance, “Just as you are mine, I have also become thine in the same manner.”2205.

gurmukhi: suMdr QI ju Dujw niRp kI su igrI BUA pY lK BUpiq pwXo ] jo brudwn dXo muih rudR vhY pRgtXo icq mY su jnwXo ]
transliteration: Soundar Thiju Dhujaa Nrip Kisu Giribhooa Pai Lakh Bhoopat(i) Paayo|| Jo Bar(u)daan Dayo Muhe Rudra Vahai Pragtyo Chit Mai Su Janaayo||
translation: On this side the king saw that his pretty banner had fallen down on the ground; he came to know in his mind that the boon bestowed on him by Rudra was going to become a reality;

gurmukhi: qau hI lau Awie khI iek XO qumrI duhqw giH mo koaU AwXo ] XO niRp bwq clXo suin kY Apny icq mY Aiq ros bFwXo ]2206]
transliteration: Tau Hilau Aae Kahiik Yau Toumriduhtaa Grah(i) Grah(i) Mo Ko( i)  Aayo|| Yau Nrip Baat Chadyo Soun(i) Kai Apne Chit Mai At(i) Ross Badhaayo||2206||
translation: At the same time, someone came to tell him that someone was living with his daughter in his house; hearing this and getting infuriated, the king went there.2206.

gurmukhi: Awvq hI kir SsqR sMBwrq kop BXo icq ros bFwXo ] kwnH ky pOqR so sXwm BnY durqw hU ky mMdr ju`Du mcwXo ]
transliteration: Oovat Hikar(i) Shastra Sanbhaarat Kop Bhayo Chit Ros Badhaayo|| Kaahn Ke Paoutra So Syaam Bhanai Duhtaa Hoo Ke Mandar Juddh(u) Machadyo||
translation: On coming, and holding his weapons with great fury, he began to fight with the son of Krishna in the house of his daughter;

gurmukhi: huie ibsMBwr prXo jb so qb hI ieh ky kir BIqr AwXo ] nwd bjwie idKwie sBo blu lY ieh ko niRp Dwm isDwXo ]2207]
transliteration: Hue Bisanbhaar Daryo Jab So Tab Hieh Ke Kar(i) Bheetar Aayo|| Naad Bajaae Dikhaae Sabho Bal(u) Lai Eh Ko Nrip Dhaam Sidhaayo||2207||
translation: When he fell down, then the king playing his horn and taking the son of Krishna with him, went towards his house.2207.

gurmukhi: kwnH ky poqR ko bwD kY BUp iPrXo auq nwrd jwie sunweI ] kwnH clo auT bYTy khw ApnI jduvI sB sYn bnweI ]
transliteration: Kaahn Ke Potra Ko Baadh Kai Bhoop Phiryo Out Naarad Jaae Sounaaee|| Kaahn Chadyo Outh Baithe Kahaa Apnijaduvisabh Sain Banaaee||
translation: On this side, the king bound down the son of Krishna and started, and on the other side, Narada told everything to Krishna. Narada said, “O Krishna ! get up and march with all the Yadava army;
